commit_message:
Install test-requirements for swiftclient functional tests

The functional test for python-swiftclient currently fails all the time because
an required package for testing (testrepository) is missing.

swift itself uses nosetest to start functional tests, but python-swiftclient
uses testr and thus requires the package testrepository to be installed.

This patch simply installs all requirements for the tests. I was able to
reproduce this error localy using a fresh virtualenv environment, and this
patch fixed it for me.

Change-Id: I5417f74d324b1915155e321c3a87138069aa35fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/16/145716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip install -r test-requirements.txt

subject: Allow Tempest to install and configure for the Neutron API job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-20 17:01:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/0dc0c14325c3a01a7fb060e9c657aa6fbaa5d98f', 'message': 'Allow Tempest to install and configure for the Neutron API job

Related patch [1] adds a variable to let Tempest install and configure
but skip the test execution. This is particularly useful for the Neutron
API job, that does rely on Tempest, but does not need Tempest to run
the tests.

commit_message:
Allow Tempest to install and configure for the Neutron API job

Related patch [1] adds a variable to let Tempest install and configure
but skip the test execution. This is particularly useful for the Neutron
API job, that does rely on Tempest, but does not need Tempest to run
the tests.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148052/

Change-Id: I5fa4484d3505aa60891f5e33e61a6e1570820f92

commit_message:
Jenkins/Puppet: increase timeout to 60 minutes

Instead of 30, increase the timeout to 60 minutes for unit &
functionnal testing in Puppet jobs.

The reason is because some modules have a lot of tests, and it takes
more than 30 minutes.

Change-Id: Ib3d71242cf52899ee64d75bb357c571d85496d50

commit_message:
Bump ironic build/callback timeouts

240sec is too aggressive of a timeout for the agent_ssh job,
which seems highly variable.

Change-Id: I7ea1890232c46ba8e89a7eb0801c2c77705b485d
Related-bug: #1408067

Change-Id: Ieec8cc64e504b04a21daa49e90e2d4925f4838ee

commit_message:
Add iptables rule for Ironic VMs -> Swift

The agent ramdisk gets instance images from swift, set firewall
rules to allow this.

Also configure Ironic API port using the correct variable, and
use SWIFT_DEFAULT_BIND_PORT for Swift ports everywhere.

Change-Id: Ieec8cc64e504b04a21daa49e90e2d4925f4838ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/58/153358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE glance swift_endpoint_url http://${HOST_IP}:${SWIFT_DEFAULT_BIND_PORT:-8080} sudo iptables -I INPUT -d $HOST_IP -p tcp --dport $IRONIC_HOSTPORT -j ACCEPT || true if [ "$IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER" == "agent_ssh" ]; then # agent ramdisk gets instance image from swift sudo iptables -I INPUT -d $HOST_IP -p tcp --dport ${SWIFT_DEFAULT_BIND_PORT:-8080} -j ACCEPT || true fi if [ "$IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER" == "agent_ssh" ]; then # agent ramdisk gets instance image from swift sudo iptables -D INPUT -d $HOST_IP -p tcp --dport ${SWIFT_DEFAULT_BIND_PORT:-8080} -j ACCEPT || true fi
deleted_lines: iniset $IRONIC_CONF_FILE glance swift_endpoint_url http://${HOST_IP}:8080 sudo iptables -I INPUT -d $HOST_IP -p tcp --dport 6385 -j ACCEPT || true

commit_message:
make audit event scoped to request session and not middleware

this patch scopes the built audit event to the request rather than
incorrectly scoping it to the middleware.

Change-Id: I41d0deaa450191c5eb18de12a1bd26a26ceeebe5
Closes-Bug: #1413617

commit_message:
Make manila tempest jobs votable

Make the existing tempest-dsvm jobs voting. Remove the old
devstack-dsvm voting job because it's now completely redundant.
The new tempest jobs also replace the devstack job for gate in
addtion to check.

Change-Id: I4477ab357e5abb2af95b5748f496fc842d6a5d42

commit_message:
Revert "make req_ref doesn't require id"

This reverts commit d1bad7674b03a6c37ee1bf5cac68c15e3f10c1b2.

The object returned by the server should typically have an
"id" field, but this change makes it so that there's no "id"
field in the server response. So now the simulated response
doesn't match the expected server response.

Change-Id: Iabb13539c379bb4250ac0622795d7352eda50828

commit_message:
Uncap boto now that nova commit f7b1af9e1 is merged

We originally tried to uncap this in nova in that change but we can't
update nova's requirements outside of global-requirements, but we did
confirm that it fixes the problem with the latest boto so we can uncap
the version constraint now.

Related-Bug: #1410622

Change-Id: Ide222477e9c14c42edca52d111cb49c43eed7feb

commit_message:
Unscoped to Scoped only

Add a config option to disable rescoping of scoped tokens
and only allow the exchange of unscoped tokens for scoped tokens.

Change-Id: Ia8e43646e901cbcfa64fb9aca64d084a76b978b0
bp: rescoping

added_lines: class RescopingScopedDisabledTests(test_v3.RestfulTestCase): def setUp(self): super(RescopingScopedDisabledTests, self).setUp() def config_overrides(self): super(RescopingScopedDisabledTests, self).config_overrides() self.config_fixture.config( group='token', rescoped_scoped=False) self.config_fixture.config( group='token', provider='keystone.token.providers.uuid.Provider') def _v3_token(self): unscoped_token = self.get_requested_token( self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.user['password'])) scoped_token = self.get_requested_token( self.build_authentication_request( token=unscoped_token, project_id=self.project_id)) return scoped_token def test_rescoping_v3_to_v3__disabled(self): self.v3_authenticate_token( self.build_authentication_request( token=self._v3_token(), project_id=self.project_id), expected_status=403) def _v2_token(self): body = { 'auth': { "tenantId": self.project['id'], 'passwordCredentials': { 'userId': self.user['id'], 'password': self.user['password'] } }} resp = self.admin_request(path='/v2.0/tokens', method='POST', body=body) v2_token_data = resp.result return v2_token_data def _v2_token_from_token(self, token): body = { 'auth': { "tenantId": self.project['id'], "token": token }} self.admin_request(path='/v2.0/tokens', method='POST', body=body, expected_status=403) def test_rescoping_v2_to_v3__disabled(self): token = self._v2_token() self.v3_authenticate_token( self.build_authentication_request( token=token['access']['token']['id'], project_id=self.project_id), expected_status=403) def test_rescoping_v3_to_v2__disabled(self): token = {'id': self._v3_token()} self._v2_token_from_token(token) def test_rescoping_v2_to_v2__disabled(self): token = self._v2_token() self._v2_token_from_token(token['access']['token'])

commit_message:
Drop old namespace for some oslo libraries

The oslo team has decided to drop the "oslo." namespacing as it was
causing a lot of trouble. So, as described [1], the namespace was
dropped in favor of the "oslo_" imports that will be used.

Note that oslo.messaging still doesn't have a release supporting their
switch to oslo_messaging, but it will come in their next release. So I
will do the switch when they have it ready.

[1] http://blog.nemebean.com/content/whys-and-hows-oslo-namespace-change

Change-Id: I4743598668d9dde540275911467b94386bad0983

commit_message:
Ironic: Adds config drive support

This patch is adding config drive v2 support for the Ironic drive. As
attaching a volume in a baremetal instance is not as simple as VMs and
also hardware depedent, this patch will base64 + gzip the generated
configdrive and pass it to Ironic as a string, Ironic then can take
care about storing and exposing it to the the tenant of baremetal.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint use-configdrive-with-ironic
Change-Id: Ibc745e9a63bc3d5d68217020b3d591f71c3f8a96

added_lines: import gzip import base64import tempfilefrom nova.api.metadata import base as instance_metadatafrom nova.i18n import _LIfrom nova.virt import configdrive def _generate_configdrive(self, instance, node, network_info, extra_md=None, files=None): """Generate a config drive. :param instance: The instance object. :param node: The node object. :param network_info: Instance network information. Ignored by this driver. :param extra_md: Optional, extra metadata to be added to the configdrive. :param files: Optional, a list of paths to files to be added to the configdrive. """ if not extra_md: extra_md = {} i_meta = instance_metadata.InstanceMetadata(instance, content=files, extra_md=extra_md, network_info=network_info) with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as uncompressed: with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as compressed: with configdrive.ConfigDriveBuilder(instance_md=i_meta) as cdb: cdb.make_drive(uncompressed.name) # Compress file uncompressed.seek(0) g = gzip.GzipFile(fileobj=compressed, mode='wb') g.writelines(uncompressed.readlines()) g.close() compressed.seek(0) encoded_configdrive = base64.b64encode(compressed.read()) # TODO(lucasagomes): Add support to upload the configdrive # to Swift and pass a tempurl to Ironic ironicclient = client_wrapper.IronicClientWrapper() patch = [{'op': 'add', 'path': '/instance_info/configdrive', 'value': encoded_configdrive}] try: ironicclient.call('node.update', node.uuid, patch) except ironic.exc.BadRequest: LOG.error(_LE("Failed to set the configdrive on node " "%(node)s when provisioning the instance " "%(instance)s"), {'node': node.uuid, 'instance': instance['uuid']}) # Config drive if configdrive.required_by(instance): LOG.info(_LI("Creating config drive for instance %(instance)s on " "baremetal node %(node)s"), {'instance': instance['uuid'], 'node': node_uuid}) extra_md = {} if admin_password: extra_md['admin_pass'] = admin_password self._generate_configdrive(instance, node, network_info, extra_md=extra_md)

commit_message:
Eliminate shell param from subprocesses in tests

Of the calls to execute a subprocess performed in tests, none of them
require a shell. Test utility method was modified to not use a shell,
eliminating a discouraged practice.

Change-Id: If2571ee8f4ea2fdf6e14416d5abe5de275d3a1c4
Closes-Bug: 1348416

commit_message:
check_valid_gerrit_config: Portability improvements

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: I92eaee39daae90d13ad4544f3fc7dc4342834d49

commit_message:
check_projects_yaml_alphabetized: Portability improvements

* For some platforms sort doesn't have --ignore-case.
  eg. NetBSD
  Use the short-name equivalent instead.

* Avoid hardcoding a full path of mktemp command.
  For some platforms it might be /usr/bin/mktemp.
  eg. NetBSD, OS X

* For some platforms mktemp -d requires a template specified.
  eg. OS X

* sh is more available than bash.  Fortunately we don't actually
  rely on bash specific features here.

Change-Id: Iafdd9b763e9aa3afe1f94b93f4aa0152631202fb

commit_message:
libvirt: fix console device for system z for log file

The system z platform needs a console device for the log file of an
instance. A (manual) regression test showed that this is not the case
with master from 2015-01-22. The guest.cpu.arch is 'None' which leads
to the creation of a wrong device. The bug was introduced with commit
11a2ed096

This fix uses the libvirt utils to decide which architecture has to be
considered.

Closes-bug: 1414038

Change-Id: I97dc55e6fca0b2491d4a9bc81366f9c92d39002a

commit_message:
Use oslo_i18n

Remove the copied over version from oslo-incubator and use
the library oslo.i18n

Change-Id: I0511c63b9c65c6585cc999c4fae0fd0b21b19d48

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """oslo.i18n integration module. See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html """ try: import oslo.i18n # NOTE(dhellmann): This reference to o-s-l-o will be replaced by the # application name when this module is synced into the separate # repository. It is OK to have more than one translation function # using the same domain, since there will still only be one message # catalog. _translators = oslo.i18n.TranslatorFactory(domain='oslo_policy') # The primary translation function using the well-known name "_" _ = _translators.primary # Translators for log levels. # # The abbreviated names are meant to reflect the usual use of a short # name like '_'. The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = _translators.log_info _LW = _translators.log_warning _LE = _translators.log_error _LC = _translators.log_critical except ImportError: # NOTE(dims): Support for cases where a project wants to use # code from oslo_policy-incubator, but is not ready to be internationalized # (like tempest) _ = _LI = _LW = _LE = _LC = lambda x: x

commit_message:
Perform an oslo-sync

Removed run_cross_tests from openstack-common.conf
Removed all of oslo_policy/openstack/common
Performed sync from latest master of oslo-incubator
Undid the delete to oslo_policy/openstack/common/_i18n.py since
it is still required, until we move to oslo.i18n.

oslo-incubator was at commit level:
  9a1970b3708114cc52f89a7b4d048eeae9140fef

Change-Id: I55288e618b268b73012784481c00285195edbf3b

commit_message:
Correct the config default for delay_auth_decision

Updated proxy-server.conf-sample with the correct default. Also
updated the note on the overview-auth doc page.

Change-Id: I5cd62a7a118a28f7b58f47b8d8d4d963f6bc7347
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/40/153340/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The authtoken config variable ``delay_auth_decisions`` must be set to ``True``. The default is ``False``, but that breaks public access, :ref:`staticweb`, :ref:`formpost`, :ref:`tempurl`, and authenticated capabilities requests (using :ref:`discoverability`).
deleted_lines: If support is required for unvalidated users (as with anonymous access or making capabilities requests using :ref:`discoverability`) or for tempurl/formpost middleware, authtoken will need to be configured with delay_auth_decision set to 1.

subject: Fix for CooperativeReader to process read length
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-20 14:30:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/da460f3019271e844a739bea6afe5854062747c9', 'message': 'Fix for CooperativeReader to properly process read length

CooperativeReader, being an eventlet-friendly wrapper around the generator-
based reader of image data, actually transforms chunk-by-chunk iteration into
the readable stream. It is used when the image is being copied from the remote
source: some generator-based image data representing the remote source acts as
its underlying object, and the instance of CooperativeReader is passed as a
data stream to the backend client which uses it to read the data.

Before this patch, the CooperativeReader was ignoring the "length" parameter of
the read method, always returning the whole chunk returned by the underlying
generator (in case of HTTP source the size of this chunk is 16 M). This was
causing problems for the clients attempting to read data from it, and - under
some circumstances - the loss of data.

For chunked storage of files in Swift a special class (ChunkReader, declared in
the swift store driver) is used to reduce the requested read length so no extra
data is read and transferred. However, this was not working as the
CooperativeReader (which was the underlying stream for the ChunkReader) was
ignoring the requested size. This was causing the data to be lost when reading
behind the boundaries of the Chunks.

This patchset introduces a buffer in the CooperativeReader to store the most
recently fetched iterator chunk. The reads are independent from requests to
iterator, so the CooperativeReader is able to return the exact requested amount
of bytes and no data is lost due to extra-reads.

Change-Id: Ief37d1e29487bb03e612320f5cc06910cfd1c23a
Closes-bug: #1412802

commit_message:
Fix for CooperativeReader to process read length

CooperativeReader, being an eventlet-friendly wrapper around the
generator- based reader of image data, actually transforms
chunk-by-chunk iteration into the readable stream. It is used when the
image is being copied from the remote source: some generator-based
image data representing the remote source acts as its underlying
object, and the instance of CooperativeReader is passed as a data
stream to the backend client which uses it to read the data.

Before this patch, the CooperativeReader was ignoring the "length"
parameter of the read method, always returning the whole chunk returned
by the underlying generator (in case of HTTP source the size of this
chunk is 16 M). This was causing problems for the clients attempting to
read data from it, and - under some circumstances - the loss of data.

For chunked storage of files in Swift a special class (ChunkReader,
declared in the swift store driver) is used to reduce the requested
read length so no extra data is read and transferred. However, this was
not working as the CooperativeReader (which was the underlying stream
for the ChunkReader) was ignoring the requested size. This was causing
the data to be lost when reading behind the boundaries of the Chunks.

This patchset introduces a buffer in the CooperativeReader to store the
most recently fetched iterator chunk. The reads are independent from
requests to iterator, so the CooperativeReader is able to return the
exact requested amount of bytes and no data is lost due to extra-reads.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ief37d1e29487bb03e612320f5cc06910cfd1c23a
Closes-bug: #1412802
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/74/148574/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: self.iterator = iter(fd) self.buffer = bytearray() self.position = 0 """Return the requested amount of bytes, fetching the next chunk of the underlying iterator when needed. if length is None: if len(self.buffer) - self.position > 0: # if no length specified but some data exists in buffer, # return that data and clear the buffer result = self.buffer[self.position:] self.buffer = bytearray() self.position = 0 return str(result) else: # otherwise read the next chunk from the underlying iterator # and return it as a whole. Reset the buffer, as subsequent # calls may specify the length try: return self.iterator.next() except StopIteration: return '' finally: self.buffer = bytearray() self.position = 0 else: result = bytearray() while len(result) < length: if self.position < len(self.buffer): chunk = self.buffer[self.position:self.position + length] result.extend(chunk) self.position += len(chunk) else: try: self.buffer = self.iterator.next() self.position = 0 except StopIteration: self.buffer = bytearray() self.position = 0 return str(result) return str(result)
deleted_lines: """Return the next chunk of the underlying iterator. if self.iterator is None: self.iterator = self.__iter__() try: return self.iterator.next() except StopIteration: return ''

commit_message:
Remove argparse from requirement

Since Glance dropped support for Python 2.6 and argparse is native in
Python >= 2.7, there's no need to pip install it.

Change-Id: Ica8a7215debd6f47555451f67a76f929c8b0e62e

added_lines: if (type(self.host) is list): for h in self.host : status_code, result = ssh_utils.execute_command(self.cmd, h, self.username, self.password) if status_code > 0: return raise_exc() return result else: status_code, result = ssh_utils.execute_command(self.cmd, if status_code > 0 : return raise_exc() return result
deleted_lines: status_code, result = ssh_utils.execute_command(self.cmd, if status_code > 0: return raise_exc() return result

commit_message:
Drop use of oslo namespace for oslo libraries

For example, instead of oslo.config, we should use oslo_config.

Related-blueprint: drop-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iee1bc653196ba699fae0fb844638bd745286ee85

commit_message:
Prepare for ability to set PowerVM uuid value

Make the current uuid cache a singleton method so we do not
need to pass it around.  In the future, we should be able
to map from an OpenStack uuid to a PowerVM uuid.

Change-Id: I2be72cfb5ef3a03087db6c98062eccfa7ce23a78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/02/153002/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, host_uuid): pvm_inst_uuid = get_pvm_uuid(instance.name, instance.uuid)def update(adapter, host_uuid, instance, flavor): entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, host_uuid)def power_on(adapter, instance, host_uuid, entry=None): if entry is None: entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, host_uuid)def power_off(adapter, instance, host_uuid, entry=None): if entry is None: entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, host_uuid)def get_pvm_uuid(name, uuid): """Get the corresponding PowerVM VM uuid of an instance uuid Maps a OpenStack instance uuid to a PowerVM uuid. For now, this just uses a cache or looks up the value from PowerVM. When we're able to set a uuid in PowerVM, then it will be a simple conversion between formats. (Stay tuned.) :param name: instance name. :param uuid: instance uuid. :returns: pvm_uuid. """ cache = UUIDCache.get_cache() return cache.lookup(name) _single = None def __new__(cls, *args, **kwds): if not isinstance(cls._single, cls): # Create it cls._single = object.__new__(cls, *args, **kwds) return cls._single @classmethod def get_cache(cls): return cls._single
deleted_lines: def get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid): :param pvm_uuids: The PowerVM UUID map (from the UUIDCache) pvm_inst_uuid = pvm_uuids.lookup(instance.name)def update(adapter, pvm_uuids, host_uuid, instance, flavor): :param pvm_uuids: The PowerVM UUID map (from the UUIDCache) entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid)def power_on(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid, entry=None): if entry is None: entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid)def power_off(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid, entry=None): if entry is None: entry = get_instance_wrapper(adapter, instance, pvm_uuids, host_uuid)

commit_message:
[Sahara] Support Cinder availability zones

Add an optional field in the node group template page. It is used for
selecting the availability zone where to create volumes.

Change-Id: I94a92425884fe0611b9bf7439030bd226b25f72c
Implements: blueprint support-cinder-availability-zones

test, and fix the old namespace imports.

commit_message:
Refactor federation SQL backend

- Move non database related operation out of the transaction
- Use with sql.transaction() as session to open new db transactions
- Remove unnecessary session = sql.get_session() line from SP operation.

Change-Id: I5ae70268e25b0ec58c7e9328fba4507611e1242e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/59/153159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Puppet documentation updates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 18:23:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator/commit/a4c1d3adf9b9c18d1a9e9426b1376a51938e1059', 'message': 'Puppet documentation updates

This patch updates the puppet documentation per our recent
switch to using packages installed by DIB. These instructions

commit_message:
Puppet documentation updates

This patch updates the puppet documentation per our recent
switch to using packages installed by DIB. These instructions
should now help users to install packages at image build
time or deployment time, whichever they choose.

Change-Id: I5bfab681ea4073112aca9df7f69cf9c3db275236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/24/153324/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: By default TripleO uses puppet for configuration only. Packages (RPMs, etc) are typically installed at image build time. in your testenv.json. If you wish to install packages at deploy time you will also need to set EnablePackageInstall to true in your overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml (see below for instructions on how to override your Heat resource registry). export OVERCLOUD_CONTROL_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS='overcloud-control' export OVERCLOUD_COMPUTE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS='overcloud-compute'
deleted_lines: in your testenv.json. export OVERCLOUD_CONTROL_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS='-p rabbitmq-server,mariadb' export OVERCLOUD_COMPUTE_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS='-p openstack-nova,openstack-neutron,openstack-ceilometer-compute'

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2011 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Local storage of variables using weak references""" import threading import weakref class WeakLocal(threading.local): def __getattribute__(self, attr): rval = super(WeakLocal, self).__getattribute__(attr) if rval: # NOTE(mikal): this bit is confusing. What is stored is a weak # reference, not the value itself. We therefore need to lookup # the weak reference and return the inner value here. rval = rval() return rval def __setattr__(self, attr, value): value = weakref.ref(value) return super(WeakLocal, self).__setattr__(attr, value) # NOTE(mikal): the name "store" should be deprecated in the future store = WeakLocal() # A "weak" store uses weak references and allows an object to fall out of scope # when it falls out of scope in the code that uses the thread local storage. A # "strong" store will hold a reference to the object so that it never falls out # of scope. weak_store = WeakLocal() strong_store = threading.local()

commit_message:
Force recreate puppet module symlinks

It's useful for this script to be re-runnable when developing locally
and for things like applying elements via instack. Force recreating the
symlinks shouldn't have any ill effect.

Change-Id: Ia2f45824a6f53853f8d2bd1d2d901170b910f1ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/37/153337/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ln -f -s /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules/* /etc/puppet/modules/

commit_message:
Return useful message when name is not unique

Catch NoUniqueMatch exceptions and return a
clear error message when a user attempts
'solum X get Y' for any resource X of (assembly,
component, plan, or pipeline), and any name Y
that is not unique of the instances of the requested
resource.

Change-Id: I4bb0be8fb28598198ad20cd57bf05f11dc21bc51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-solumclient refs/changes/29/152629/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from solumclient.common import excfrom solumclient.openstack.common.apiclient import exceptions try: if uuidutils.is_uuid_like(name_or_uuid): return super(AssemblyManager, self).get( base_url="/v1", assembly_id=name_or_uuid) else: return super(AssemblyManager, self).findone( name=name_or_uuid) except exceptions.NoUniqueMatch: raise exc.NotUnique(resource='Assembly')
deleted_lines: if uuidutils.is_uuid_like(name_or_uuid): return super(AssemblyManager, self).get( base_url="/v1", assembly_id=name_or_uuid) else: return super(AssemblyManager, self).findone(name=name_or_uuid)

commit_message:
Support region_name for Heat

In environments with more than one region, heat will just pick the first
endpoints it sees in the catalog unless the region is specified. This
allows the ability to tell Heat which region to use

Change-Id: I795315fee8955d9c1c29e273852f6dad3b777019

commit_message:
Use stevedore to load alarm rules api

Alarm rule evaluators are loadable with stevedore, but not the API side,
since wsme 0.6 it's now possible to do it.

This change adds that to allow to create a gnocchi alarm rule api and
evaluator in the gnocchi code tree.

This also move out the V2Controller API from __init__ to avoid
recursive import with stevedore.

Change-Id: I468f9f82b41eb7f4896dd93a8c62ce63b49535bb

commit_message:
More details for policy-engine-trigger

Change-Id: Ib29f5edc3aded2c45f383cadedee414fbf64a540
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress-specs refs/changes/32/142232/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: We will create a trigger-registry interface that enables a programmer to dictate a function to run each time the contents of a given table changes. Programmer's perspective ------------------------ The functions that a programmer will register have a signature like the one that follows. def respond_to_trigger(oldtable, newtable, delta) The programmer will register this handler on a particular theory and a particular table. In this example, we register the function above so it runs each time the table "p" changes in the policy/theory "th". # instance of congress/policy/runtime.py:Theory th = engine.policy("alice_policy") # register 'respond_to_trigger' for table 'p' on that policy th.register_trigger("p", respond_to_trigger) From the programmer's point of view, each time the contents of table "p" changes in the theory named "alice_policy", the function respond_to_trigger is run and given as arguments the original table, the new table, and the difference in the two. Implementation --------------- The function 'register_trigger' will be implemented in the congress/policy/runtime.py:Theory class. We will also have an 'unregister_trigger' function call. The Theory class will be augmented to contain a hash table 'self.triggers' that maps each table name to the set of functions that have been registered for that table. 'register_trigger' and 'unregister_trigger' change the contents of that hash table. Then changes will be made to NonrecursiveRuleTheory, MaterializedViewTheory, and Database to implement the trigger: each time update() is called, the theory will (i) compute the contents of each table that has a trigger registered, (ii) apply the usual update() logic, (iii) compute the contents of each table with a registered trigger (again), (iv) compute the deltas on each of the tables with triggers (v) for each table t with non-empty delta, invoke all of the triggers registered for t giving the arguments (i), (iii), (iv) Obviously triggers can be expensive because they require 2 queries each time data is changed. Ideally, we would utilize policy analysis to only query those tables when the data being update might possibly change the contents of those tables. For example, suppose we registered a trigger for table p, and we had 2 rules: p(x) :- q(x) r(x) :- t(x) Updates to table t could never change the contents of p, but updates to table q COULD change the contents of p. Hence, the trigger implementation would run queries on p only when the incoming update changes q.
deleted_lines: To each Theory class or subclass in runtime.py we will add an interface for event-handler registration, e.g. Theory.register_handler(tablename, function) To each Theory we will add code that implements all the triggers that have been registered.

commit_message:
Cap pycadf to 0.5.1

pycadf release 0.6.0 bumped the minimum for oslo.messaging to 1.4.0
causing nova-manage to die when only 1.3.1 was found.

Closes-bug: #1418422

Change-Id: Ic430110991d7e2a4a216ce0a3c20c5ae411faa58

commit_message:
Add cloudfoundry datasource driver

This patch adds a datasource driver to congress that integrates with
cloudfoundry. This driver exports the following tables with cloudfoundry
data: organizations, apps, spaces.

Implements blueprint: cloudfoundry-datasource-driver

Change-Id: I632fbf95f6a24ec975448aaa4929fa8a290c3cc3
Co-authored-by: Sabha Parameswaran <sabhap@pivotal.io>

commit_message:
Add debug info to timeout exception in _hotplug_server

Add the old port and number of new ports in the timeout exception in
_hotplug_server so we can better trace the port requests through the
neutron logs.

Related-Bug: #1321207

Change-Id: Iee79bc286e77547e672f81b83d02e5bfba1fc743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/54/153254/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: raise exceptions.TimeoutException("No new port attached to the " "server in time (%s sec) !" % CONF.network.build_timeout)

commit_message:
Removing service.engine._log_operation_exception

Method service.engine._log_operation_exception has not
been used for a long time. It should be removed.

Change-Id: If7931c949a13dfdb5c15010dfdfbb9bdfcd9d15a
Closes-bug: #1418499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/99/153199/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _log_operation_exception(self, message, cluster, ex): # we want to log the initial exception even if cluster was deleted cluster_name = cluster.name if cluster is not None else '_unknown_' LOG.warn(message, {'cluster': cluster_name, 'reason': ex}) if cluster is None: LOG.warn( _LW("Presumably the operation failed because the cluster was " "deleted by a user during the process."))

commit_message:
Make runtime.py obey private method convention

Modified internal methods and calls in runtime.py to start with _ as per
convention.

Fixes Bug: 1415201

Change-Id: Icfdeea0899f5bd280d2ba13584194c9fff5a2655

commit_message:
Using oslo_* instead of oslo.*

Changes:
* using oslo_config instead of oslo.config
* using oslo_concurrency instead of oslo.concurrency
* using oslo_db instead of oslo.db
* using oslo_i18n instead of oslo.i18n
* using oslo_messaging instead of oslo.messaging
* using oslo_middleware instead of oslo.middleware
* using oslo_serialization instead of oslo.serialization
* using oslo_utils instead of oslo.utils

Change-Id: Ib0f18603ca5b0885256a39a96a3620d05260a272
Closes-bug: #1414587

subject: puppet: Add EnablePackageInstall option
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 02:56:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3373c5d59abe38335212b477ffc9b76f2531c90a', 'message': "puppet: Add DisablePackageInstall option

This adds an option which disables package installation via
Yum when Puppet executes. This can be useful if you wish to
pre-install your package with DIB and only have Puppet perform
configuration (not installation).

The option is off by default: meaning that Puppet will still
install and configure packages by default.

The intent is to use the default_parameters section
of the Heat environment to allow users to cleanly enable this
features without wiring it into the top level. This is because
the new parameter is Puppet specific and doesn't really apply to
other implementations. Kilo Heat already has support for
default_parameters and so does python-heatclient.

NOTE: most TripleO users do not yet have the heatclient
features because setup-clienttools in tripleo-incubator only installs
releases via pip. (perhaps we should change this!) Our inconsistent
use of trunk for some things and releases for others makes no
sense in some cases. It is for these reasons the default_parameters
section in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml is commented out
for now.

Change-Id: I3af71b801b87d080b367d9e4a1fb44c1bfea6e87

commit_message:
puppet: Add EnablePackageInstall option

This adds an option which enables package installation via
Yum when Puppet executes. Users might want to disable Yum
installation of packages via puppet when using pre-installed
images.

The option is off by default: meaning that Puppet will no
longer install packages by default. Users will need to
enable the EnablePackageInstall in order to get
the previous behavior.

The intent is to use the default_parameters section
of the Heat environment to allow users to cleanly enable this
features without wiring it into the top level. This is because
the new parameter is Puppet specific and doesn't really apply to
other implementations. Kilo Heat already has support for
default_parameters and so does python-heatclient.

NOTE: most TripleO users do not yet have the heatclient
features because setup-clienttools in tripleo-incubator only installs
releases via pip. It is for these reasons the default_parameters
section in overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml is commented out
for now.

Change-Id: I3af71b801b87d080b367d9e4a1fb44c1bfea6e87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/19/153119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Configures namespace deletion

Add option to the L3 and DHCP agent configuration to
enable automatic deletion of router and DHCP namespaces
when the router or network is deleted.

Change-Id: I75d5eb4bac4b1d163b44f7ea27db01b62a80bedd
backport: Juno
Closes-Bug: 1404941
(cherry picked from commit 09e0ef8958b1b893cf82cf35366733d2ece132ba)

commit_message:
Added check for translation LOG.warn.

Since patch I20a62c1d1e953f52a63565b8446f1561d178d5af
we can use LOG.warn.

So hacking rule for translation `_LW` for LOG.warn was added.

Change-Id: I2911dfdceeadc575f0996305da0e7f506e2e7340

commit_message:
Initial Tempest Directory

Tempest test directory with api and scenario directory.
To be used for creating  neutron-lbaas tests.

commit_message:
Add overcloud-compute element.

This element pre-installs all packages required for an
overcloud compute image.

Change-Id: Ie85dece58a5892f3ac0fb7aeabd65772784dc1c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/81/153281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Install all packages required for the overcloud compute role.

commit_message:
Reseller

With this implementation, we'll cover the Reseller Use case
where one will be able to resell a project that behaves like
a domain, where we can create users, roles and groups.

Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Brito <andrey@dsc.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: bp reseller

Change-Id: I52509d08a945653b9d692022f1df0e59f6407f8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/24/139824/29 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Reseller Use Case ========================================== `bp reseller <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reseller>`_ OpenStack needs to grow support for hierarchical ownership of objects. This enables the management of subsets of users and projects in a way that is much more comfortable for private clouds and gives to public cloud providers the option of selling a a piece of his cloud. Problem Description =================== Use Case 1: * Resellers **Actors** * Martha - owner of ProductionIT * Joe - Development Manager from WidgetMaster * Sam - Development Manager from SuperDevShop Martha provides IT services to multiple enterprise clients. She would like to offer cloud services to Joe at WidgetMaster, and Sam at SuperDevShop. Joe has multiple QA and Development teams with many users. Joe needs the ability to create users, projects, and quotas, as well as the ability to list and delete resources across WidgetMaster. Martha needs to be able to set the quotas for both WidgetMaster and SuperDevShop; Joe can manage users, projects and quotas in WidgetMaster as well as Sam in SuperDevShop. She also needs to ensure that Joe cannot see or manipulate anything owned by Sam. Others Use Cases: * Contracting parties * Mergers/aquisitions Proposed Change =============== Implement support to limit sharing of resources both upwards and downwards in the project's hierarchy. To achieve this, the domains construct will be merged with the project, allowing to distribute users in any point of the hierarchy, instead of only in a single, root, domain. With this implementation, we'll cover the Reseller Use case, where one will be able to resell both a project and a project that behaves like a domain, where one can create users, roles and groups. * It will also be possible to update an existing project to make it behave like a domain by setting the "domain-ness" capability; * The domains will only be created under another domain, never under a project; * Once the user creates a domain or updates a project to become a domain, this property is immutable. In other words, if a project has became a domain, won't be possible to rollback this change. However, this constraint should have a way to be easily deactivated in case makes sense for future changes in this concept. Alternatives ------------ None Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- Python-keystoneclient must support creating and updating projects that behave as a domain. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- A new column in the Project Table representing that this project will now become a domain. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Raildo Mascena <raildo> Other contributors: Andrey Brito <abrito> Henrique Truta <henriquetruta> Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigodsousa> Work Items ---------- 1. 'Domain-ness' as an attribute of a project; 2. The list domains v3 API call must show only top level (root) projects for compatability; 3. Domains and projects can't have the same name; 4. When requested a domain scoped token, provide a dual scoped token, referencing the project which holds that domain; 5. Create a constraint to ensure that the domain parent will always be another domain; 6. One time that set to True, we need to make the 'domain-ness' property immutable; * Note: For details about role assignments in the hierarchy, see the domain role spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/133855 Dependencies ============ * Depends on Hierarchical Multitenancy improvements spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135309/ Documentation Impact ==================== The Identity API v3 Documentation must be updated according to these changes. References ========== * `Kilo Summit Summary <https://www.morganfainberg.com/blog/2014/11/12/kilo-summit-summary/#hm>`_ * `Keystone Meetup Summit <https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kilo-keystone-meetup>`_

Move the script for running pre-releases into oslotest

Rather than maintaining the pre-release runner in oslo-incubator, put it
in oslotest where it can be installed with the rest of the library.

None value.

commit_message:
Make params order fixed in stack forms

Horizon input fields may be swapped when launching stack instances
with some errors. The patch make params order fixed by simply sort
them.

Change-Id: Ied3e681cfa76a52bde824ddc91ff3c1851b3cac3
Closes-Bug: #1417515
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/09/152509/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # no parameter groups, simply sorted to make the order fixed params_in_order = [(k, params[k]) for k in sorted(params)]
deleted_lines: # no parameter groups, so no way to determine order params_in_order = params.items()

commit_message:
Puppet: SNMP support for undercloud ceilometer

This configures an snmp agent for the undercloud
ceilometer 'hardware' metering. This rely's on the
razorsedge/puppet-snmp which we are adding in
 I8ae104de7382767c3448a493cd37ff2994cf4f52.

Change-Id: If2b6b63279b9b0402c5136ff1635e10acad1de7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/50/151950/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $snmpd_user = hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name') snmp::snmpv3_user { $snmpd_user: authtype => 'MD5', authpass => hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_password'), } class { 'snmp': agentaddress => ['udp:161','udp6:[::1]:161'], snmpd_config => [ join(['rouser ', hiera('snmpd_readonly_user_name')]), 'proc cron', 'includeAllDisks 10%', 'master agentx', 'trapsink localhost public', 'iquerySecName internalUser', 'rouser internalUser', 'defaultMonitors yes', 'linkUpDownNotifications yes' ], }

commit_message:
Puppet: wire in neutron_dnsmasq_options

This patch updates puppet on the controller so that it
configures the Neutron dnsmasq options file data with
the value provided by the Heat NeutronDnsmasqOptions
parameter.

Properly configuring this setting can help resolve/tune
overcloud instance connectivity issues w/ SSH etc.

Change-Id: If47ab3d3002ebe19fc980ca5d37f84f4d8851f9b

commit_message:
Puppet: move LB configs onto LB resources

This moves the loadbalancer composition class parameters
into the loadbalancer specific software deployment.
This keeps the resource contained and seperate from the rest
of the OS hiera data configs.

Change-Id: I8af48b479348e431a8e563917e1345ca4b895a60

commit_message:
Puppet: Heat API and Engine

This patch adds the ability to configure the Heat API and
Heat engine on controller nodes via puppet.

Change-Id: Ie81090bceed3e18199a36ebb11d1cbcaea83c410

commit_message:
Include endpoint type with neutron client

This was added to master back on Dec. 1, but it was never back-
ported into Juno. There isn't another option rather than re-submitting
the patch because this was before our migration to Gerrit/Launchpad.

This should only be added to the Juno branch. The latest 10.1.2 RC
tag also needs to be rebuilt with this patch added.

Change-Id: Ib17e224f7eff4d273c77131e2b27a93224672ab1
Closes-Bug: 1418237

Fixed in consistent lowercase service

- Added an uppercase "Service" to match the documented conventions and the
usage in the rest of the document.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions#Service_and_project_names

Change-Id: I2f2bc6a2bcfbdddb345dfe512646e33e26551333

subject: Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 00:08:04.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cinder_volume_solidfire_spec.rb', 'spec/defines/cinder_backend_solidfire_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/solidfire.pp', 'manifests/volume/solidfire.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder/commit/d4040c7b083a7dad91450834470acf21df449af8', 'message': "Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

Change-Id: I5f127931b924209793f1d8fff4299b44b50291b7
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to using the new SolidFire driver name

The driver name for the SolidFire driver switched back in July of 2013:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/fd139faaf3d3fc96825bbaf3397a529e5762d92c

There was a mapping of the old driver name to the new driver name until
April 2014 which is when it was removed:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/commit/64f71b3306f7652bee60245d62af090aaa572cf7

With the Juno release the old driver name (SolidFire) can't be used any
more and must be changed to the new one (SolidFireDriver).

Change-Id: I5f127931b924209793f1d8fff4299b44b50291b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/37/152737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added hacking rule for assertEqual(a in b, True/False).

The following replacements were done in tests to have
clearer messages in case of failure:
- assertEqual(a in b, True) with assertIn(a, b)
- assertEqual(a in b, False) with assertNotIn(a, b)

The error message would now be like:
   'abc' not in ['a', 'b', 'c']
rather than:
   MismatchError: False != True

Change-Id: I514daca3a470feef5d332a1a319cba15256fc6ea

description, but it confuses developers/users because of mismatching

commit_message:
Remove v1.1 from v2.1 extension description

Current v2.1 os-user-data extension only includes "v1.1" in the
description, but it confuses developers/users because of mismatching
versions. In addition, the other extensions doesn't contain version
number in their descriptions.
So this patch removes v1.1 from os-user-data extension's description.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I6280a0633c0e416e4b1798a708035eaf8c979fba

commit_message:
Change logic in find_resource() to identify upper-case/lower-case name.

Currently find_resource() searches resource with human_id before does
with name_attr.  With this logic, find_resource() cannot identify
upper/lower case. In find_resource(), human_id always matches and
name_attr never used in find_resource() because human_id made from
small letters of name_attr string (see bug/1318503).

To identify upper/lower case, name_attr should be used before human_id.
This fix moves name_attr to ahead of human_id with unit-test cases.

Change-Id: I9b821d7111c11a97be38f19de06172daf410022d
Closes-Bug: #1318503

commit_message:
Add first pass at post_test_hook for functional tests

Add first pass at getting a post_test_hook working. Once the project
config side of this lands this script can be self gating.

Change-Id: I5b0f5508f8e0a2a13f71e4a6b7a29a0d1a59b951
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/36/151036/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # This script is executed inside post_test_hook function in devstack gate. function generate_testr_results{ if [ -f .testrepository/0 ]; then sudo testr last --subunit > $WORKSPACE/testrepository.subunit sudo mv $WORKSPACE/testrepository.subunit $BASE/logs/testrepository.subunit sudo python /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/subunit2html.py $BASE/logs/testrepository.subunit $BASE/logs/testr_results.html sudo gzip -9 $BASE/logs/testrepository.subunit sudo gzip -9 $BASE/logs/testr_results.html sudo chown jenkins:jenkins $BASE/logs/testrepository.subunit.gz $BASE/logs/testr_results.html.gz sudo chmod a+r $BASE/logs/testrepository.subunit.gz $BASE/logs/testr_results.html.gz fi } export NOVACLIENT_DIR="$BASE/new/python-novaclient" # Go to the novaclient dir cd $NOVACLIENT_DIR sudo chown -R jenkins:stack $NOVACLIENT_DIR # Run tests echo "Running novaclient functional test suite" set +e sudo -H -u jenkins tox -efunctional EXIT_CODE=$? set -e # Collect and parse result generate_testr_results exit $EXIT_CODE

commit_message:
Fixing monasca-agent check and check_all

The command-line debugging tools "monasca-collector check check_name_here"
and "monasca-collector check_all" were hanging on the multi-threaded
ServicesCheck based agent checks.  Added calls to stop the thread pool
after the checks ran.  Removed duplicate code.

Change-Id: Iac033beafc1c055de13eba855819a881629ad55d

commit_message:
Remove the X-Newest pre-flight request on X-Timestamp

There is a standard LBYL race that can better be addressed by making the
EAFP case safer.

Capture 409 Conflict during expect on PUT

Similarly to how the proxy handles 412 on PUT, we will gather 409
responses in the proxy during _connect_put_node.  Rather than skipping
backend servers that already have a synced copy of an object we will
accept their response and return 202 immediately.

This is particularly useful to internal clients who are using
X-Timestamp to sync transfers (e.g. container-sync and
container-reconciler).

No observable change in client facing behavior except that swift is
faster to respond Accepted when it already has the data the client is
purposing to send.

Change-Id: Ie400d5bfd9ab28b290abce2e790889d78726095f

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2010-2015 OpenStack Foundation # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import unittest import os from swift.common.base_storage_server import BaseStorageServer from tempfile import mkdtemp class TestBaseStorageServer(unittest.TestCase): """Test swift.common.base_storage_server""" def setUp(self): self.tmpdir = mkdtemp() self.testdir = os.path.join(self.tmpdir, 'tmp_test_base_storage_server') def test_server_type(self): conf = {'devices': self.testdir, 'mount_check': 'false'} baseserver = BaseStorageServer(conf) msg = 'Storage nodes have not implemented the Server type.' try: baseserver.server_type except NotImplementedError as e: self.assertEquals(e.message, msg) def test_allowed_methods(self): conf = {'devices': self.testdir, 'mount_check': 'false'} try: baseserver = BaseStorageServer(conf) allowed_methods = [] allowed_methods = baseserver.allowed_methods(self) self.assertEquals(allowed_methods, 'OPTIONS') except NotImplementedError: pass try: baseserver = BaseStorageServer(conf) baseserver.replication_server = 'true' allowed_methods = [] allowed_methods = baseserver.allowed_methods(self) self.assertEquals(allowed_methods, []) except NotImplementedError: pass try: baseserver = BaseStorageServer(conf) baseserver.replication_server = 'false' allowed_methods = [] allowed_methods = baseserver.allowed_methods(self) self.assertEquals(allowed_methods, 'OPTIONS') except NotImplementedError: pass

commit_message:
Adjust release note template whitespace

Without a noteable changes file the release notes included extra blank
lines in a few places. Adjust the whitespace treatment to fix that, and
to indent URLs in the output.

Change-Id: Ib79a3fb237f2fab07cc9d30be4cc89b79957c7e5

commit_message:
Introduced "naming conventions" SA feature

In the current state some constraints has no defined names
in the project.

So they are generated by DB engine automatically and each DB generates
constraint names in its own fashion. This makes difficult to operate
with constraints, for example in migrations, where they should be
referred by names.

SQLAlchemy provides the feature for generation of constraint names
using patterns.

Leveraging it will bring consistency to constraints naming
in the project.

Change-Id: Iee4e05dd3f0067fe90a40a9e85ffd518ed0f65f8

added_lines: NAMING_CONVENTION = { "ix": 'ix_%(table_name)s_%(column_0_name)s', "uq": "uq_%(table_name)s_%(column_0_name)s", "ck": "ck_%(table_name)s_%(constraint_name)s", "fk": "fk_%(table_name)s_%(column_0_name)s_" "%(referred_table_name)s_%(referred_column_0_name)s", "pk": "pk_%(table_name)s" } Base = declarative.declarative_base( cls=_MuranoBase, metadata=sa.MetaData(naming_convention=NAMING_CONVENTION) )

commit_message:
Deprecated SQLite usage

- SQLite is no longer recommended to use for development as well
  as for production.
- Everything related to SQLite wiped out from DB migrations,
  so they no longer can be executed on SQLite.
  More specifically - `transform_table` helper was replaced with
  Alembic commands.
- Added special commands for those who still want to use SQLite:
    `register-models` - synchronizes models with DB with "CREATE TABLE"
                        statements.
    `unregister-models` - opposite of previous command.
  With them you can avoid to use migrations and still be able to synchronize
  models with DB automatically.
- Added corresponding amendments to documentation.

See related discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-January/055055.html

Related-Bug: #1399151
Change-Id: I0c93b0f0d936aef97955ec232bd794cc15955dd2

commit_message:
Add dependency on upstream ceph cookbook for better key management

The upstream ceph cookbook already hooks into chef for environment information.
This patch utilizes the client LWRP to create or add ceph keys for RBD support.
This patch also changes some default attribute names for more sane organization

Partial-Bug: #1409943

Change-Id: Ibba6c568d4e4d00153061458b71593cd28714e60

Right now, nova-compute will attempt to build an infinite number of
instances, if asked to do so. This won't work on any machine, regardless
of the resources, if the number of instances is too large.

We could default this to zero to retain the current behavior, but

should default to something. Ten instances for a single compute node

commit_message:
Add max_concurrent_builds limit configuration

Right now, nova-compute will attempt to build an infinite number of
instances, if asked to do so. This won't work on any machine, regardless
of the resources, if the number of instances is too large.

We could default this to zero to retain the current behavior, but
the current behavior is really not sane in any case, so I think we
should default to something. Ten instances for a single compute node
seems like as reasonable default. If you can do more than ten at a
time, you're definitely not running a cloud based on default config.

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable

Closes-Bug: #1418155

Change-Id: I412d2849fd16430e6926fc983c031babb7ad04d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/153004/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add dependency on upstream ceph cookbook for better key management

The upstream ceph cookbook already hooks into chef for environment information.
This patch utilizes the client LWRP to create or add ceph keys for RBD support.
This patch also changes some default attribute names for more sane organization

Partial-Bug: #1409943

Change-Id: If37159524c237eec6ca1561e2979cd44e6dfac92

commit_message:
Add tox env for running release notes script

The python version of the release notes script needs several other
packages to work. Set up a tox environment to run it instead of relying
on the user to install those packages separately.

Change-Id: Ic2285f115250bc4375842a6dd682da6ca44bbf9b

commit_message:
DevOps framework refactoring

  Remove fuel-devops.devops.manager.Manager class.
  Split models.py into separate parts.
  Change Environment model's interface.
  Change database name from 'postgres' to 'fuel-devops'.
  Reform imports.
  Move methods from fuel-main.fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel to
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment.
  Update package version from 2.6.9. to 2.9.0

Change-Id: I8de449193df44b70ddeb1b0709698ebfe0120c77
Implements: blueprint system-tests-and-devops-refactoring
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/15/149615/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from devops.models import Environment environment = Environment.create('cdrom')

commit_message:
port-list support get-port-from-mac

cli command port-show use the restapi 'get /v1/port/detail?address
={macaddress}', it also lack restapi 'get /v1/port?address={mac}'

add port-list to get the port which has macaddress:
 ironic port-list --address {macaddress}
 ironic port-list --address {macaddress} --detail

Change-Id: I4d836940974812360066b7d977472991235cb5c9
Closes-Bug: #1416627
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/68/151868/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self, address=None, limit=None, marker=None, sort_key=None, :param address:Optional, MAC address of a port, to get the port which has this MAC address if address is not None: filters.append('address=%s' % address)

commit_message:
support time to live on event database for MongoDB

event database will grow gradually, currently, even though we can
dump data to 3rd storage, the old data cannot be cleaned.

This patch adds a new option [database].event_time_to_live, and
create ttl index on event collection for MongoDB backend.
Also change previous [database].time_to_live to precise
[database].metering_time_to_live.

To enable test_bin, this patch also simply implements log://

partially implements blueprint event-database-ttl
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d67cf212f37d3fa5555870a8e7cbb65af205d63

commit_message:
Update requirements.txt

The requirements.txt file was stale.
- argparse is included in py27 now
- we are using some oslo libs which weren't listed

Tihs updates requirements.txt based on what we're actually using.

Change-Id: I9877b93d300b0caf2b4992cb1b50c705fd525173

commit_message:
Add missing setup.cfg entry for os-user-data plugin

Although os-user-data has an entry in nova.api.v3.extensions.server.create
in setup.cfg it is missing one in the general nova.api.v3.extensions list.
Without an entry the plugin does not appear in the extension list so this
patch adds an entry for it.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I13fa049539b07ff901b36ae18eca59fbb1354794

commit_message:
libvirt: generate proper config for PCS containers

Previous patches for PCS support allow to start virtual
machines only. For spawning containers we need to provide
os_init_path and 'filesystem' with root fs instead of
'disk'.

This patch adds basic support - you can only start
a container from an image.

Partially implements blueprint pcs-support

Change-Id: Ic19db3a6798de060f0eda75947b69a71c4a0fcbc

commit_message:
libvirt: add ability to add file and block based filesystem

Extend class LibvirtConfigGuestFilesys so it will be
possible to add filesystems of type 'block' and 'file'
for libvirt domain xml. Since 1.0.6 libvirt can setup
loop or nbd device, mount root fs and start container
from that fs. Filesystems of type 'file' also used in
parallels driver for containers.

Also add method libvirt_fs_info to class Image, so you
can get libvirt's config for given Image object with
one call.

Partially implements blueprint pcs-support

Change-Id: I62004a2a48827e869d3a7534e94dda2d6a067497

commit_message:
Update Power State after deleting instance

Update the power state for an instance when deleting it.
Instead of being stuck in the 'Running' power state after deletion,
a deleted instance will be in the NOSTATE power state.

Change-Id: I2be9094af21e00868ad066118e94355b09f64346
Closes-Bug: #1392798

commit_message:
test_update_instance_port_admin_state

This test validates instance public connectivity
status by changing instance port admin_state_up
to True & False.

Change-Id: I3ada84cd6a65932869330a657a999266cfb67081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/02/145702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_update_instance_port_admin_state(self): """ 1. Check public connectivity before updating admin_state_up attribute of instance port to False 2. Check public connectivity after updating admin_state_up attribute of instance port to False 3. Check public connectivity after updating admin_state_up attribute of instance port to True """ self._setup_network_and_servers() floating_ip, server = self.floating_ip_tuple server_id = server['id'] port_id = self._list_ports(device_id=server_id)[0]['id'] self.check_public_network_connectivity( should_connect=True, msg="before updating " "admin_state_up of instance port to False") self.network_client.update_port(port_id, admin_state_up=False) self.check_public_network_connectivity( should_connect=False, msg="after updating " "admin_state_up of instance port to False", should_check_floating_ip_status=False) self.network_client.update_port(port_id, admin_state_up=True) self.check_public_network_connectivity( should_connect=True, msg="after updating " "admin_state_up of instance port to True")

commit_message:
Move to hacking 0.10

Release notes:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/hacking/tag/?id=0.10.0

Per the release notes, H307, H803 and H904 has been removed.

Fix code issues with H238 and W292.

Change-Id: I747ebb64db5825bc70f1ae19c1c1f5ca2089c06d

commit_message:
Remove min and max from base.Version

The min and max attributes from the base.Version class is not needed,
it was set and used before when checking versions but right now we only
use the major and minor attributes.

Change-Id: Ic501db26a00c96ca55eb8fbcfc7b318599a48158

commit_message:
Revert "Make neutron the default in devstack"

The simple case of a single interface doesn't work
out of the box, and this is now failing for lots of 
people. We need to back up and get that working.

This reverts commit c906bb38851037880f557b15ad30c9b0bb7fa295.

Change-Id: If20df670e06cda2d65028bceb46d257d011cf917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/08/153208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Update auth_token section in documentation

Bring docs in line with changes to auth_token config
defaults made in I7076fa03ab531cbb1114918f75113620b65590dc

Change-Id: Ia21685ebd1f3ed7bdba9de2ebac9fdcce8495949
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/87/152487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: identity_uri = http://keystonehost:35357/ auth_uri = http://keystonehost:5000/your situation, but in short: * ``identity_uri`` points to the Keystone Admin service. This information is used by the middleware to actually query Keystone about the validity of the authentication tokens. It is not necessary to append any Keystone API version number to this URI.* ``auth_uri`` should point to a Keystone service from which users may retrieve tokens. This value is used in the `WWW-Authenticate` header that auth_token sends with any denial response.
deleted_lines: auth_host = keystonehost auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = http auth_uri = http://keystonehost:5000/your situation. For more information, please refer to the `Keystone auth_token middleware documentation <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystonemiddleware/middlewarearchitecture.html#configuration>`_, but in short: * Those variables beginning with ``auth_`` point to the Keystone Admin service. This information is used by the middleware to actually query Keystone about the validity of the authentication tokens.* If you wish to authenticate using Keystone's v3 API you must set the ``auth_version`` option to ``v3.0``.

commit_message:
Adds "list-groups" testcase to v3/test_groups

This submission is to verify list-groups functionality
and also added required support function under
"identity_client.py" file.

Change-Id: I870c9f7a056688b90532eb89afc50b621afe6238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/152850/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_list_groups(self): # Test to list groups group_ids = list() fetched_ids = list() for _ in range(3): name = data_utils.rand_name('Group') description = data_utils.rand_name('Description') group = self.client.create_group(name, description=description) self.addCleanup(self.client.delete_group, group['id']) group_ids.append(group['id']) # List and Verify Groups body = self.client.list_groups() for g in body: fetched_ids.append(g['id']) missing_groups = [g for g in group_ids if g not in fetched_ids] self.assertEqual(0, len(missing_groups))

commit_message:
Test case for database limits

This submission adds a new test script "test_limits.py",
so as to verify "limit-list" of Database API.

Required supporting functions are added in new client
file "limits_client.py" under JSON interface.

Modified base.py and clients.py files

Change-Id: Ie981254fbada27ec458b93980d353c387c75a3e1

subject: add _LW for log functions in API layer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-06 16:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/extensions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7fcb66a8750e34c4e8646a5cd05c69544508ebf4', 'message': "add _LW for log functions in API layer

The pep8 check only checks format LOG.warning but
it didn't check logger.warning, and nova need to translate
the warning messages.
This patch also replace a warn with warning due to py3 compatible.

Change-Id: I32078b9acde6070e1e3dc784a492b08b83926f3f
"}]
commit_message:
add _LW for log functions in API layer

The pep8 check only checks format LOG.warning but
it didn't check logger.warning, and nova need to translate
the warning messages.
This patch also replace a warn with warning due to py3 compatible.

Change-Id: I32078b9acde6070e1e3dc784a492b08b83926f3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/145264/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logger.warning(_LW('Failed to load extension %(classpath)s: ' '%(exc)s'), {'classpath': classpath, 'exc': exc}) logger.warning(_LW('Failed to load extension %(ext_name)s:' '%(exc)s'), {'ext_name': ext_name, 'exc': exc})
deleted_lines: logger.warn(_('Failed to load extension %(classpath)s: ' '%(exc)s'), {'classpath': classpath, 'exc': exc}) logger.warn(_('Failed to load extension %(ext_name)s:' '%(exc)s'), {'ext_name': ext_name, 'exc': exc})

commit_message:
kombu: fix driver loading with kombu+qpid scheme

When a url looks like: kombu+qpid:///host:port/ the driver fail
to load.

This change fixes that, adds a warning message that this kind of
URL is experimental and not yet supported.

Also our Consumer code use internal kombu API that can be optionnal
implemented by the kombu transport (message_to_python),
so check that this one exists before using it.

In the future, we should use kombu.messaging.Consumer/Publisher
instead of Consumer/Publisher implementation to avoid such hack...

Change-Id: I066d57c23bff922c5734ab036b6ca8e1608e5c6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/59/140059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ('qpid', dict(url='kombu+qpid://user:password@host:10/virtual_host', expected=['qpid://user:password@host:10/virtual_host'])), ('rabbit', dict(url='kombu+rabbit://user:password@host:10/virtual_host', expected=['amqp://user:password@host:10/virtual_host'])),

commit_message:
mirror/centos: fix downloading of src.rpm's

An old version was downloading everything (including the upsteam sources)
and completely ingnoring errors. As a side effect only used to be
downloaded. Later on a proper error handling has been added, which break
downloadin src.rpm's. Fix the download rules so only Mirantis' sources
get fetched.

Change-Id: I1c43e0bb38a7fea34f1c7b2b9eb701a734341268
Closes-Bug: #1418390

commit_message:
Fix PatchStacktraceTest for pypy

test_trace test cannot pass with mocked do_execute on pypy
environment. Allow test to call do_execute with correct sql
query.

Change-Id: I165fc4de9f4a7f10cb45e92301652224e63f113b

subject: Fix StaleDataError on DVR bind update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-24 02:46:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/5926a030bcbaf5205ffecc3110a3e8da5c555f1d', 'message': 'Fix StaleDataError on DVR bind update

If a router is deleted concurrently while a router port is being bound,
the update query may fail because of the empty resultset.

To avoid this error, this patch moves the committed udpdate under the
same db context that validates that the port still exists, before the
update.

This change should not lead to unexpected surprises or unveil new
failure modes. Alternatively, it would be safer to catch the StaleDataError
and gracefully log that the router has been deleted while processing the
dvr binding.

This patch takes the bolder, and slightly cleaner approach.

Change-Id: I223d08dd3202c4a578db3d8257d9b76f66129a75
Closes-bug: #1372141
'}]
commit_message:
Fix StaleDataError on DVR bind update

If a router is deleted concurrently while a router port is being bound,
the update query may fail because of the empty resultset.

To avoid this error, this patch moves the committed udpdate under the
same db context that validates that the port still exists, before the
update.

This change should not lead to unexpected surprises or unveil new
failure modes. Alternatively, it would be safer to catch the StaleDataError
and gracefully log that the router has been deleted while processing the
dvr binding.

This patch takes the bolder, and slightly cleaner approach.

Change-Id: I223d08dd3202c4a578db3d8257d9b76f66129a75
Closes-bug: #1372141
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/61/143761/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Puppet: Ntp support

This patch adds NTP support to all roles.

As part of this change overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml has
also been updated so that it passes the NtpServer parameters into
the Swift and Cinder storage node templates so that Ntp can
also be configured on those machines as well.

NOTE: The puppet support here uses the puppetlabs-ntp modules
which we add in Ib10ccbfdb3140b19f40049707548c6655d250e1c.

Change-Id: If2ef236fa42a714e84c6944eee5fe4daddf3fedf

** WIP **

This patch adds the MANAGEABLE state, and associated transitions to and
from AVAILABLE, as well as a new RPC method to initiate transitions
between provisioning states.

PROOF OF CONCEPT: I think I can move all the check logic from the API
into the conductor, and replace the do_node_deploy and do_node_teardown
RPC calls with a single new "do_provision_action" call, using the state
machine. NOT YET IMPLEMENTED.

It also adds a new VERBS entity to ironic/common/states.py to hold the
action-phrases, as described in blueprint new-ironic-state-machine. I
may split this into a separate commit, but we'll need to do this to
migrate the "deleted" action to the now-required "delete" action.

** WIP **

Change-Id: Id0af5a607b7432d287eef643c1e30e324dc4f879

It updates the API controller for nodes.py without changing the HTTP
status codes which are returned in exception cases. The changes in unit
tests now prepare the node appropriately, but do not change the
assertions being tested.

Juno also allowed the rebuild of a failed deploy to be initiated by
PUTting a target state of "active"; this behavior, while inconsistent
with the new state machine, is preserved for compatibility.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Change-Id: Id0af5a607b7432d287eef643c1e30e324dc4f879

commit_message:
Add MANAGEABLE state and associated transitions

This patch adds the MANAGEABLE state, and associated transitions to and
from AVAILABLE, as well as a new RPC method to initiate transitions
between provisioning states.

It also adds a new VERBS entity to ironic/common/states.py to hold the
action-phrases, as described in blueprint new-ironic-state-machine. This
provides a single place to check whether a requested target state is
allowed to be requested by checking if the value is "in" the keys of
this dictionary. It also provides a mapping for two phrases which are
currently inconsistent:
  target:deleted -> action:delete
  target:active  -> action:deploy

It updates the API controller for nodes.py without changing the HTTP
status codes which are returned in exception cases. The changes in unit
tests now prepare the node appropriately, but do not change the
assertions being tested.

Juno allowed the rebuild of a failed deploy to be initiated by PUTting
a target state of "active"; this behavior, while inconsistent with the
new state machine, is added to the state model for compatibility, now
that stronger checking is done within the API service, based on the
actual modelling of state transitions.

Implements: blueprint new-ironic-state-machine

Co-Authored-By: David Shrewsbury <shrewsbury.dave@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Id0af5a607b7432d287eef643c1e30e324dc4f879

commit_message:
Fix up help message for reset-state call

There's some confusion about what the reset-state
call does.  It's not clear to some that this call
simply changes the state of the object in the data-base.

This patch just updates the help message to indicate more
clearly that reset-state ONLY changes state in the DB.

Change-Id: Ia389cfd8b1a821a356706201c009cf3c8dca8419

commit_message:
add --no-traits for event-list

Currently we print traits list for each event when run event-list
command, but that is a lot of information. After system run for a
few days, the event-list command prints so much that it is not
convenient to know the whole event-list even with less command.

This patch adds a simple argument called --no-traits, it is False
by default, event-list will not print traits if this argument is
specified. Since this argument is boolean type, no need to assign
a value, if it is specified, then it is actived.

Change-Id: Ib69209fef5967a18f094f2d4665fa189e4ca3e6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/45/147745/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
